channel.title: Verinia
channel.description:
Alright, this is just a small project i've been working on, and i need some feedback or suggestions.
Do not flame too much, i'm pretty new at website designing.
Verinia is just a website i've made for the server verinia, which was total shit.
[url=http://examplesite.net76.net/verinia/]Verinia - Meet your nostalgia today.[/url]
Thank you.

without a matching opening tag, and the list goes on.[/quote]

item.title: Verinia
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Coldmedicine:

Feedback on the looks, not how i work.

The looks don’t matter if the code behind the template is fucked. As Anthony said, it won’t work everywhere if your code is a fucking state.

If you really want to be this “good designer” you said you were then you need to focus on the code before the visual aspect, you must walk before you can run.

Read full topic

item.title: Verinia
item.dc:creator: @voetbal645 voetbal645
item.description:
@voetbal645 wrote:

Coldmedicine:

Feedback on the looks, not how i work.

About the look, Try to put more time in your design. Try to make one with photoshop. Because now it’s just a background with boxes and a banner. It’s not even a professional look. Don’t use to much inner shadows and stuff like that. Look at templates and get some inspiration, that’s not a shame every designer is doing that. Then inspirate you on a template and add your unique stuff to it. It would be a lot better then starting with nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Verinia
item.dc:creator: @voetbal645 voetbal645
item.description:
@voetbal645 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:6, topic:547451”][quote author=Coldmedicine link=topic=666359.msg4455089#msg4455089 date=1414262106]
I used the division method for the hover on the logo.

I dont know what deprecated means…

I don’t see what’s wrong with

I tabbed the CSS

I hate you, so why even bother trying to help me?
[/quote]
You need to go back to the basics. Everything you’re writing is outdated and wouldn’t have been viable in HTML4 nevermind HTML5.

You can hate me all you want but I don’t see anyone else here posting who knows what they’re doing. Fuck it, keep writing shit and don’t listen to the people who know what they’re talking about.

Have fun never improving.[/quote]
Ruby is right. Learn the basic of HTML5 and CSS3. I looked at your html code and it’s messed up.
In HTML5 we don’t use a div for a navigation bar. We use the tag. Also the tags is writened in the CSS. These are just two examples that I have taken out of your html code but there are many more. You ask for feedback and suggestions but if you won’t take our critism you will never learn it. We try to teach you something.

Read full topic

item.title: Verinia
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

First problem:

No need to assign a separate tag for logo, you can include that in the img tag.
Don’t ever use tags, they’ve been deprecated for years. All styling should be done through CSS.

Further deprecation is here:

<h2><p><font color="white">Hey there!</p></h2>
	<h3><br>The forums are up and running! We hope you enjoy.</font></h3>

Don’t use font tags, once again they are deprecated. Styling through CSS. Your header tags should also generally have a selector on them so you know what they’re for and can individually style as needed, not a necessity but it’s a good practice to get into.

Further issues:

You’ve used the tag after declaring it a HTML5 document, if you’re using HTML5 you should generally be paying attention to the semantic meaning behind using or .

<br>No idea still
<br>No clue at all

Don’t use line breaks in this instance. Think about what you’re trying to do. You’re trying to LIST the staff members. So use a list, not linebreaks. With web design always think about what you’re trying to do, there’s usually a tag just for it.

<div id="box1">

Don’t name things “box” “box1” etc, have better naming so others know what they’re referring to. Also, since “box1” is used more than once it should be a class selector, not an id selector.

You should also never have more than one open and one closing body tag in a document, it only needs to be initiated once. You open it once and close it twice, the middle closing tag shouldn’t be there.

On to the CSS:

	margin-bottom: 5px;
	    border-bottom-left-radius: 3em;
		    border-bottom-right-radius: 3em;
			padding-left: 10px;

Stick to using either em or px, preferably em for a fluid and responsive template.

A general tidy up of the CSS is needed, I can’t even read most of it because it’s such an eyesore. Work on tabbing and general neatness of code and then I’ll take a look at that.

Improvement from the HeavenX template, but still pretty shitty with a lot of room for improvement.

Keep at it, I suppose.

Read full topic
